title: Man City's Ilkay Gundogan gives fans an insight into his life with Q&A session
text:
Man City's Ilkay Gundogan gives fans an insight into his life with Q&A session Manchester City's midfielder has been out since December when he suffered a knee injury. Ilkay Gundogan has a bit of time on his hands at the moment as he recovers from his knee operation and before City 's FA Cup tie kicked off he decided to answer fan's questions. 
The German has been sidelined since December but is back in Manchester after undergoing surgery in Barcelona . 
The 26-year-old said that his rehab was going well and he was working hard to be back on the pitch as soon as possible. 
Other insights he gave into his life were that he prefers beards to mustaches, he's the one who spends longest in the shower and in an odd choice his favourite drink is Spezi, a mixture of Coke and Fanta. 
Speaking about his time at City he said his favourite game for City this season was the Champions League tie against Barcelona and he has a special connection with Leroy Sane. 
In answer to how he had settled in at City he explained: "Very well, I feel so comfortable at the club. Definitely took the right decision and can't wait to be back on the field again." 
The most random question was to ask him if the thought Aleksandar Kolarov could become president of Serbia. 
No question and answer session these days seems to be complete without the inevitable Messi or Ronaldo question. 
He answered Messi and given Ronaldo's Manchester United links that will definitely have earned him some good fan points. 
Given that he's got a good few more months on the sidelines these question and answer sessions could become a regular pre-match feature. Read More
